comment.author: 42023484@N00
comment._content: I feel sad that morons have to make fun of the ladies in this photo.

comment.author: 46033226@N00
comment._content: my feeling exactly...the ladies don't care about the morons...they are above all that - they are living life out loud.

comment.author: 13282622@N06
comment._content: The morons don't stop to think about the things that shape a person and why the women in this photo became "Girlie dancers"at a fair. I grew up in Vermont and have been to this fair. I am positive it was a difficult life. The lady in the middle clearly has a deep scar on her forhead. Abuse? Maybe. I wonder about the woman's stories and their lives. I wonder if they survived at all. Having drunken, red neck men, gawking at them night and day under a sweating tent full of cigar and cigarette smoke. But the comments on the photo just prove most people don't see past the end of their nose. I am sure their stories would have made a best seller and I would have gladly read it. Maybe I will write it for them.

comment.author: 13282622@N06
comment._content: So I will. "My real name is Ruth, the Ruth from the bible. My stage name is "Sadie The Sinner." Was I ever a child of God? They say God watches over children and fools, I'm no longer a child so I guess that makes me a fool. A foolish woman. The foolish woman Blues, now there would be a good song! We all have stage names, slave names, call it what you will. Blondyene Lane is the real star of the show. I am too old now to be the star of anyhing. But, hidden from the public, I keep my sanity in a old hat box. I keep things I found town after town. I keep buttons I find, they are always losing them here on the mid way and I know how to make a costume. I keep my Dinah Washington records along with a lovely pine cone I found  and a broken sky blue Robins egg I found once near the stage steps. I keep them all under my bed out back. If I can keep those things I just might make it through another night of  this! Just let me hear Dinah Washington sing Me and my Gin, just another night. Just one more night of this!

comment.author: 99653776@N00
comment._content:
This is a wonderful shot! 

Jason, thank you for sending me the link to it... and thanks for telling Ruth's story. Poor old Ruth...

comment.author: 41894197052@N01
comment._content: I have a hard time believing these girls "danced the cooch" when it looks like they're wearing big top performers' costumes. In fact, these outfits wouldn't even be appropriate for the bally. If they really are "girlie" show girls, then it's interesting that they started the show off looking so modestly. Or perhaps it was a poor circus, and they had to take what they could get, costume-wise and otherwise.
